entry.title: Forking personal "vanity" versions...
entry.summary: In a discussion thread started by Alan Grimes on July 28, 2011, he responded to those who believe that there are too many vanity versions of bitcoin. He mentioned a specific 'vanity version' of bitcoin that eliminates the use of libdb or requires users not to have its development headers installed on their system. The context suggests that this version may be more streamlined and easier to use for some individuals. However, there is no further information provided about this particular version of bitcoin or its features.
